--- title: Rhomboid Major --- ![Muscles of the Neck and Back @OpenStaxAnatomyPhysiology2022](/The Archive/Images/OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e/fig11.15 Muscles of the Neck and Back.jpeg){#fig-openstax-fig11.15} ![Muscles that position the Pectoral Girdle @OpenStaxAnatomyPhysiology2022](/The Archive/Images/OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e/fig11.22 Muscles That Position the Pectoral Girdle.jpeg){#fig-openstax-fig11.22} ::: {.callout title="Reading list"} - Trigger points - Rhomboid minor and major Muscle @donnellyTravellSimonsSimons2019 - Rhomboids @finandoTriggerPointTherapy2005 - @neumannKinesiologyMusculoskeletalSystem2017 - MMT @weinstockNeuroKineticTherapyInnovative2010 ::: ::: {#tbl-oian .cell message='false' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Rhomboid major T1-T4 SP Medial border of scapula (below scapular spine) Dorsal scapular n.
C4 - C5		 Scapula: Retraction, Downward rotation, Stabilization
``` ::: ::: # Origin {#origin} SP T1â€“T4 @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Insertion {#insertion} Medial border of scapula (*below scapular spine*) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ![Left scapula (Posterior view) @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Osteology/image203 gray1918 Left scapula. Dorsal surface.gif){#fig-gray1918-image203} # Innervation {#innervation} [Dorsal Scapular N.]({{< var ref-dorsal-scapular-nerve.path >}}) ([C4]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c4 >}}), [C5]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c5 >}})) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} **STJ**: Retraction, Downward rotation, Stabilization @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 The rhomboid major fixes the scapula to the thoracic wall @jonesProjectFoundations2025. # Function The Serratus Anterior (along with the rhomboids) serves to aid in scapular stability during arm elevation @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020 # Release {#release} Compressing the rhomboid against the ribcage is not the most effective way to release this muscle. It is better to stabilize the scapula with one hand and drive the fingertips of the other hand anterolaterally deep to the scapula in order to apply a stretch @jonesProjectFoundations2025. # Paralysis {#paralysis} Rhomboid paralysis can result in a separation of the scapula from the thoracic wall, known as a "scapular winging sign" @jonesProjectFoundations2025.
